properties.areaDesc: Sumter, SC; Kershaw, SC; Richland, SC; Lee, SC; Calhoun, SC; Lexington, SC
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 12:24PM EST until January 13 at 3:15PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a

* Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for Poor Drainage Areas
for...
Lee County in central South Carolina...
Northwestern Calhoun County in central South Carolina...
Lexington County in central South Carolina...
Northwestern Sumter County in central South Carolina...
Southern Kershaw County in central South Carolina...
Eastern Richland County in central South Carolina...

* Until 315 PM EST.

* At 1221 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated
heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small
stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will result in
minor flooding in the advisory area, especially as ditches and
culverts fill and small streams overflow their banks. Excessive
ponding on roadways is also expected. One to two inches inches of
rain have already fallen since yesterday evening, and another inch
or more is possible today.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Columbia, Sumter, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Forest Acres,
Camden, Bishopville, Springdale, Dentsville, Oak Grove, McEntire
Air Base, Red Bank, St. Andrews, South Congaree, Pine Ridge,
Gaston, Arcadia Lakes, Eastover and Lugoff.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
